messages.title: How we can change the future together

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP wants a FAIRER Australian-style points-based system to decide who comes to work and settle here.
UKIP will SCRAP income tax on the minimum wage, SCRAP the bedroom tax, and SCRAP taxes on children when you die.
UKIP will pour an extra £3 billion a year EXTRA into the NHS to keep it as a free public service, funded by scrapping the £55 million a day EU membership fee.
By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £80 billion a year spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the ONLY PARTY with money to spend at home.

issues.brexitEurope: By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £80 billion a year spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the ONLY PARTY with money to spend at home.
issues.economy: By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £80 billion a year spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the ONLY PARTY with money to spend at home.

issues.socialWelfare: UKIP will SCRAP income tax on the minimum wage, SCRAP the bedroom tax, and SCRAP taxes on children when you die.

images.caption: Barry Mahoney - UKIP - Change the future together

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by Richard Crouch on behalf of Barry Mahoney, both at UKIP, 394 Holdenhurst Road, Bournemouth, BH8 8AY. Printed by Full Spectrum Print Media, Unit 3, Barle Enterprise Centre, Dulverton, Somerset, TA22 9BF.
